citation.article-title: Limibacter armeniacum gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel representative of the family 'Flammeovirgaceae' isolated from marine sediment.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Limibacter [Li.mi.bac′ter. L. adj. limus mud; N.L. masc. n. bacter (equivalent of Gr. neut. n. baktron) rod or staff; N.L. masc. n. Limibacter rod from mud, referring to the isolation source of the first strains].
Cells are rod-shaped, Gram-negative and strictly aerobic.
Nitrate and nitrite are not reduced.
The major respiratory menaquinone is MK-7.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain of the type species is 27.9 mol%.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 1ω7c.
The type species is Limibacter armeniacum.
